snippet: Prosecutors say the aide, Sharon Lee, was a member of an alleged so-called straw donor scheme that began in 2009 to raise money for John C. Liu’s campaign.
abstract: Judge Richard J Sullivan of Federal District Court in Manhattan rules that prosecutors may call Sharon Lee,  longtime aide to New York City Comptroller John C Liu, to testify in the trial of Jia Hou and Xing Wu Pan, two former associates charged in an illegal campaign fund-raising scheme.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors say the aide, Sharon Lee, was a member of an alleged so-called straw donor scheme that began in 2009 to raise money for John C. Liu’s campaign.

headline.seo: Longtime Liu Aide May Be Called in Trial
headline.main: Trusted Deputy to Liu May Be Called in Trial
headline.print_headline: Trusted Deputy to Liu May Be Called in Trial
